image.altText: Two dads and one exuberant girl.

props.synopsis: Stephen and Mitch Page say they wouldn't know the joy of fatherhood without it, but this week, Pope Francis called for a worldwide ban on surrogacy, saying the practice violates the dignity of women. So what do surrogacy experts say?

title.children: Elizabeth was born to a surrogate mother, an act the pope deems 'deplorable' and wants banned

image.altText: Patients being treated at the Royal Melbourne Hospital road trauma unit.

props.synopsis: Last year was the deadliest on Australia's roads in five years, but there's no national record of how many people were left injured.

title.children: Kate works at one of Australia's busiest hospitals. Road injuries represent a 'huge chunk' of its cases

image.altText: Protesters burning flags.

props.synopsis: Yemen's Houthi rebels vow fierce retaliation for US and British strikes against them, further raising the prospect of a wider conflict in a region already beset by Israel's war in Gaza.

title.children: US launches another attack on Houthi rebels, Biden warns of further strikes

image.altText: Firefighters with hoses near a line of smouldering trees.

props.synopsis: Two bushfire emergency warnings are issued for parts of the Shire of Chittering north-east of Perth, with lives and homes under threat.

title.children: Lives, homes under threat from two bushfires burning in the Shire of Chittering north-east of Perth

image.altText: A snake dangles from an ice dispenser on a fridge door.

props.synopsis: When she went to turn off the radio in her outdoor entertainment area, Adelaide Hills resident Gail Auricht thought the hissing sound she could hear was an air compressor — then she spotted a red-bellied black snake caught in her fridge.

title.children: 'Enough to send a chill down anyone's spine': Snake found dangling down from ice dispenser on fridge door

image.altText: a woman sits on her curb which is laoded with flood-damaged belongings

props.synopsis: Weary residents in storm-ravaged towns, who had just started to get on top of clean-up efforts, are facing the possibility of more rain.

title.children: 'Here we go again': Monsoon could bring 'menacing' thunderstorms, more rain to Far North Queensland

image.altText: The side of a plane that has a fuselage plug area covered by plastic.

props.synopsis: The Federal Aviation Administration said the continued grounding of the planes was for the safety of American travellers.

title.children: US regulator grounds all Boeing 737 MAX 9 airplanes indefinitely, as inspections of each aircraft continue

image.altText: a young african man sitting behind weights at a gym

props.synopsis: Yiel Gatluak, 19, was found dead on a remote road near Alice Springs on New Year's Day. NT detectives are expected to apply to a Victorian court for the extradition of a fourth person arrested in relation to his death.

title.children: Fourth person arrested in Victoria over suspicious death of teen near Alice Springs

image.altText: Penny Wong covers a microphone while speaking to a government official

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong is one of the nation's most disciplined politicians, who heavily calculates everything she says. It's a skill she'll need as she faces her biggest challenge to date when she touches down in the Middle East.

title.children: Penny Wong never misses a microphone. She'll need that skill as she navigates the Middle East

image.altText: A mid shot of a woman in the foreground holding a mobile phone, with a blurred verandah in the background

props.synopsis: Central Queensland's Deborah McGee and other residents in the region went without a Telstra mobile service for weeks following storms in December, a situation a telecommunications academic says can be helped with domestic roaming.

title.children: Prolonged Telstra outage after Queensland storms prompts renewed calls for domestic roaming

image.altText: A woman smiling wearing a white dress holding onto a man wearing a black blazer and a white shirt.

props.synopsis: Jacinda Ardern had to reschedule her wedding in 2022 because of lockdown restrictions.

title.children: Former NZ prime minister ties the knot after engagement of nearly five years

image.altText: fans of princess mary gather at sydney's slip inn now el loco ahead of her proclamation as queen of denmark

props.synopsis: On the eve of Princess Mary's royal proclamation, fans are clinking their glasses at the Slip Inn where her royal journey started almost 24 years ago.

title.children: Sydneysiders celebrate 'something about Mary' at pub where royal love story began

image.altText: CCTV footage superimposed with comments from Facebook

props.synopsis: Communities are going online to help catch alleged criminals at work in their neighbourhoods. But experts say "digital vigilantism" can land people in hot water.

title.children: Why posting on social media about crimes in your neighbourhood could backfire

image.altText: dark clouds gather over nightcliff darwin

props.synopsis: The ongoing rains are making a mockery of spring headlines warning of dangerous bushfires and water shortages, setting a platform for Australia to record a wetter than normal summer.

title.children: Parts of Australia could see further flooding in coming days as polar vortex strengthens

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and wearing a hat sits in an aeroplane.

props.synopsis: From an alleged poisoning plot to uprooted royals on the run and a secret romance that divided a family, these are just a few accounts of Australia's royal encounters.

title.children: Before the rise of Queen Mary, another Sydney girl spent her life as a wandering queen in exile

image.altText: Two purple, concentric circles with a red line passing through it.

props.synopsis: Astronomers have discovered a surprising "signal" from outside of our galaxy after analysing 13 years of data from NASA's Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope.

title.children: NASA astronomers detect high-energy 'signal' from outside our galaxy in 'serendipitous discovery'

image.altText: Three people hold brooms as they sweep debris off the ground in front of a store.

props.synopsis: The national death toll from violent riots in Papua New Guinea has climbed to 22, with the remains of six people found in Port Moresby today.

title.children: Discovery of six bodies lifts death toll in PNG riots to 22

props.synopsis: The Australian Open might call Melbourne Park home now, but nearly every state capital has hosted the Asia Pacific's grand slam at some stage, as well as two cities in New Zealand. But there's not been any venue more unusual than Perth Zoo.

title.children: The Australian Open is one of tennis's most loved tournaments — but it was once played in a zoo

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou clenches his fist

props.synopsis: Ange Postecoglou has been a revelation at Tottenham in his first months at the club, and with a trip to Old Trafford to face Manchester United to kick off the second half of the season, he still believes his Spurs can win the biggest prize of all.

title.children: Tottenham in the thick of Premier League title race, Postecoglou insists

image.altText: a killer whale in the water

props.synopsis: Pods of more than 70 orcas have been recorded at the Bremer Canyon off Western Australia's south coast as the annual season starts with high numbers of killer whales in good health.

title.children: Bremer Bay orcas 'healthiest on the globe' as numbers boom off Western Australia

image.altText: Side profiles of Rishi Sunak and Volodimir Zelenskyy behind him.

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak unveils a new billion-dollar military funding package for Ukraine aimed at reassuring the country that the West is still providing support nearly 23 months after Russia's invasion.

title.children: Ukraine receives billion-dollar military funding package from United Kingdom

image.altText: A man with long grey beard, black and blue mechanic's shirt, shorts, stands in front of old Volkswagen vehicles.

props.synopsis: From Kombi vans to Beetles, the soon-to-be-retired mechanic's backyard collection of vintage Volkswagens has been a labour of love for nearly 40 years.

title.children: Take a drive down memory lane in these rusty relics with the unofficial king of vintage Volkswagens

image.altText: Multiple green and blue jaggered lines with blocks of grey in between them.

props.synopsis: The settlements were occupied around 500 BC and 300 to 600 AD — a period roughly contemporaneous with the Roman Empire in Europe.

title.children: Laser-sensor technology reveals ancient cities in Ecuador's Amazon rainforest

image.altText: DPP campaign rally

props.synopsis: Taiwan is voting today to choose its next president. As the election result becomes clear, Canberra will have some delicate decisions to make.

title.children: What is Taiwan's capital? The answer is a clue to why the island's election today is so fraught

image.altText: The stage of a music festival

props.synopsis: A woman is in a critical condition after a suspected drug overdose, with two men arrested for drug offences at Juicy Fest on Friday night.

title.children: Melbourne music festival marred by suspected overdose and drug arrests

image.altText: A gloved hand holding two old photos.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of photographs captured during the 1800s and 1900s have been found in a suitcase on the New South Wales Central Coast after being hidden for nearly a century.

title.children: Hidden in a suitcase for nearly a century, 'rare' photos of royals, sporting moments and WWI are now up for auction

image.altText: The hull of a white and red kayak in the water facing a sunset.

props.synopsis: These friends lost a mate two years ago. They hope their gruelling journey from Strait to Tassie will help others have "open communication" about mental health and seek help.

title.children: Friends kayak across Bass Strait to raise awareness about youth mental health after losing mate

image.altText: A  smiling woman holds her little daughter in a snowsuit as her squat on snowy mountains.

props.synopsis: At a time when most toddlers are just getting the hang of walking, 18-month-olf Lucy Brown has staked her claim as the youngest person to reach the Mount Everest base camp.

title.children: Perth toddler continues family legacy of record-setting Mount Everest climbs
